comments.body:
Will it mark object as abstract if it contains an abstract class? e.g.:
```object A { abstract class B  { abstract def foo: Int } }```
I added tests to cover that case

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +205,209 @@  private def isAbstract(m: Member | MGroup): Boolean = m match
    case m: Member => m.modifiers.exists(Set(Modifier.Abstract, Modifier.Deferred).contains)
    case g: MGroup => g.members.exists(isAbstract)

  private type SubGroup = (String, Seq[Member | MGroup])

comments.body: Members are sort by poistion in the source files/files. Three is a way to sort members by name using buttons.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +180,184 @@    div(cls := "documentableList")(
      h3(cls:="groupHeader")(name),
      members.sortBy {
        case m: Member => m.name
        case MGroup(_, _, name) => name
